company's founders. Eric Schmidt will be moved into a new post of executive chairman. Cofounder Sergey Brin will work on new and strategic products. The reason for the change, the company said, is to streamline decision making and create clearer lines of responsibility and accountability. who has led Google for a decade, will become executive chairman focusing on external relations, deals and government relations.New Yorker writer Ken Auletta , who has written a book on the company, reported Friday that Eric Schmidt had been nudged aside.`` Ken Auletta said that after losing out to Page and co-founder Sergey Brin over the company's China policy a year ago,`` Eric Schmidt lost some energy and focus.`` Eric Schmidt was also criticized for allowing Google to be overtaken by Facebook, for the company's increasingly frequent privacy scandals and its increasing internal bureaucracy.
